description.narrative:
Sweden provides 450 000 000 SEK over 4 years to the Government of Bangladesh to implement the national Health, Population and Nutrition Sector Development Programme. Up to 15 000 000 SEK are provided for technical assistance and to cover costs including monitoring and evaluation. It is proposed that 9 500 000 SEK are allocated for technical assistance to UNFPA and the implementation of the programme ”Technical Assistance to Strengthen the Quality of Maternal Health Services” during the period 15th November, 2015 – 31st December, 2016.
The technical assistance from UNFPA will facilitate specific midwifery training and regulatory functions. The support will make a contribution to the training of midwifes and streamlining the recruitment and promotion of midwifes as a new cadre of health professionals. Also, UNFPA will support the MoH to develop policy formulation for midwifery, operating procedures for this new profession, as well as strengthening quality assurance of the profession. During 2015 and 2016 this efforts will be intensified, which motivates the short-term support from Sweden.

UNFPA Bangladesh har ansökt om stöd från Sverige för att genomföra projektet ”Technical Assistance to Strengthen the Quality of Maternal Health Services” på 9 500 000 SEK för perioden, 15 november 2015 – 31 december 2016.
Insatsen gäller tekniskt stöd från UNFPA i form av överföring av sakkunskap och rådgivning till hälsoministeriet. De svenska medlen kommer främst att finansiera en internationell och en nationell barnmorskespecialist som under ledning av UNFPA ska ge stöd till hälsoministeriet att bygga upp verksamheten kring barnmorskeyrket i Bangladesh. UNFPA ska bistå hälsoministeriet i utformningen av det legala och institutionella ramverket för yrkesutövningen samt vid utformningen av den nya barnmorskeutbildningen. Sedan 2012 har hälsoministeriet genomfört flera insatser för att introducera barnmorskeyrket i Bangladesh. Under 2015 och 2016 förväntas arbetet med det institutionella ramverket för yrkesutövandet samt tillsynen över yrkesutövningen intensifieras, vilket motiverar det svenska stödet. Insatsens totala budget är på 15 000 000 SEK för en ett-års period där UNFPAs egen insats uppgår till 5 500 000 SEK.

The specific outcome is to strengthen the quality of maternal health services, which is linked to the result framework of Bangladesh´s Health Sector Programme HPNSDP 2011-2016: Increased utilisation of essential HPN services, Maternal neonatal and child health, family planning and reproductive Health. The intervention will make a direct contribution to the achievement of the national development goals in order to reach MDG 5 on maternal health and MDG 4 on child health.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: Achievements: 1. Master programme in SRHR created. 2. Five Centers of Excellence (CoE) for midwifery education created. 3. The midwifery-led care model introduced in the sub-district hospitals of Chittagong, Dhala, Moulzibazar, Rangpur and Sylhet. 4. 1200 midwifes deployed to Upazila Health complexes. 5. National Emergency Obstetric and Newborn Care Plan developed. 6. The enactment of the National Nursing and Midwifery Act.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
